title: Amazon launches its first skincare brand
text:
From Harper's BAZAAR

We earn a commission for products purchased through some links in this article

Following on from the January launch of its first make-up range, Find Beauty, Amazon has launched itself into the world of skincare.

Belei – deriving from ‘Believe in beauty’ – is a refreshingly low-priced 19-piece range, with cleansers starting at £8 and the priciest products coming in at £20.

"Our approach when creating Belei was to build a premium yet affordable brand that helps customers spend less time searching for the ‘right’ solutions for everyday skin concerns while still offering a wide selection," says Fiona Secola, amazon.co.uk’s senior vendor manager for beauty.

The products are aimed at people concerned with anti-ageing and those with ultra-sensitive skin, but Bazaar thinks it could be a good starter range for anyone getting in to skincare. The mix-and-match line is unisex and was formulated and manufactured in Switzerland.

"We know that customers love skincare, especially buying it online," says Secola. "We wanted to create something no-fuss and simple to navigate."

Bazaar tried a few of the products at the launch and was particularly impressed with the Vitamin Booster Serum (£20), which feels more like a primer (so might be one to look out for if you don’t get along with oilier serums) and contains both a derivative of vitamin C and vitamin E. Meanwhile, the Fresh Complexion Face Peel (£12) is a simple, gentle physical exfoliant for those averse to acids.

Skincare buffs might still prefer something a little more techy – no retinols here – but the range has cottoned on to the fact that people like to wash their face in different ways, offering five different types of cleanser - with every product, naturally, qualifying for next day delivery.
